column4: volumeid can't be installed on my edgy because of /sbin/vol_id that's also in udev, how do I fix this ?
fresh install or upgrade?
do a complete reinstallation
excuse me ?
the upgrade is breaking stuff..it's easier to just do a complete fresh install
it certainly is *not* an option here
dunno what to tell you then
hrm, "the upgrade breaks stuff, so reinstall" is very... shall I say... "windowish" ! THere has to be another solution.
nope
i am an old debianer..used it for about 5 years..and i still say your best shot is to reinstall
look, those 2 packages conflict, this is gonna get fixed at some point most likely
possibly..you really want to wait for that?
shit, been using debian for 10 years, and am a DD, so I just won't reinstall my system because some maintainer botched some packages !
lol cool
in any case, how would reinstalling fix anything, I mean /sbin/volume_id is still gonna be a conflict, right ?
no i don't think so
how not ?
no one else has had that issue yet
i'm not sure though how no one else is seeing that :\
there, manually removed the old udev that caused problem. It took a bunch of packages with it on the way out, but I can now reinstall them.
congrats, that's the good ol debian spirit :D
heh
